text.section: Therefore, it is the intent of the General Assembly in creating the Employers' Mutual Insurance Authority to establish a self-supporting competitive state fund for the purpose of providing both a market of last resort for employers in the Commonwealth and another competitive source of insurance in the voluntary market through which employers may secure and maintain their workers' compensation coverage required under this chapter.

law.history: Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 181, sec. 39, effective April 4, 1994.
